column1:
## History of presenting illness
79 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-29 with a suspected influenza. Found outside the special care facility by the patients family coming to visit.

## Past medical history
Advanced COPD, smoker, benign prostate hyperplasia, schizophrenia.

## Treatment course
Patient complains of headache and pain in left hip. No findings in physical examination. Temp 36,7. Sat 85%. CRP 43. PCR positive for Influenza A. CT brain, cervical spine and pelvis without remarks. CT thorax: patchy bilateral pulmonary infiltrates and 9 mm large nodular change in the left upper lobe. Received Oseltamivir and Cefotaxime intravenously for Influenza infection and suspected on top bacterial infection. Received Oxygen with saturation limit 90%. Patient feels better after antibiotics. Dyspnea only when mobilizing. Shown growth of Klamydia in culture. No findings in other cultures. CRP 199, rising initially. LPK normal. Temp 38,8. Liver enzymes a bit elevated, assessed to be due to influenza. No fever. Saturation 95% with 1 l oxygen but declined to 88% without Oxygen. Receives a urinary catheter because of residual urine 533 ml. Recieves Movicol for contstipation. After five days of Cefotaxim switch to per oral doxycycline until 2024-02-04 after contact with infectious disease consultant. Patient uses walker to mobilise and has fallen multiple times lately. Transported to the geriatric care department according to recommendationts of physiotherapist and occupational therapist .

## Medications
Anoro Ellipta (Umeclidinium, Vilanterol)	55/22 Î¼g/Î¼g 1+0+0
Finasterid (Finasteride) 5 Mg	1+0+0
Olanzapin (Olanzapine) 10 Mg 1+0+0
Tamiflu (Oseltamivir) 75 Mg 1+0+1
Alvedon (Paracetamol) 500 Mg 2+2+2
Doxycyklin (Doxycycline)100 Mg 1+0+0 until 2024-02-04

## Plan after discharge
Referral to primary care for radiological control of nodular change in left upper lobe in 8-12 weeks.

## Procedures
  None

## Secondary diagnosis
Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia
Klamydia bacterial pneumonia
Advanced COPD
Benign prostate hyperplasia
Schizophrenia

## Main diagnosis 
J10.0 Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia
J15.0 Unspecified bacterial pneumonia

## Differential diagnosis
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with (acute) exacerbation
